item.title: 欧洲金融监督机构质疑国债的避风港地位
item.description: 欧洲保险监管机构负责人表示，美国国债市场近期的波动正在使其作为避风港的地位受到质疑。【原文：The head of Europe’s insurance watchdog said the US Treasury market’s recent volatility is bringing into question its status as a safe haven.】

item.title: 众议院中国委员会敦促美国银行放弃 CATL 上市角色
item.description: 美国国会中国问题委员会主席呼吁美国银行（Bank of America Corp.Ltd.的股票出售工作，这可能是今年最大的一次上市交易。【原文：The chairman of a US congressional committee on China is calling on Bank of America Corp. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. to withdraw from working on the Hong Kong first-time share sale of battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., which could be the year’s biggest listing.】

item.title: 道琼斯工业指数将与 S&P 500 指数出现历史性背离
item.description: 美国股市的蓝筹晴雨表--道琼斯工业平均指数（Dow Jones Industrial Average）有可能会出现历史上表现不佳的一天。【原文：The US stock market’s blue-chip barometer, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, is potentially heading for a day of historical underperformance.】

item.title: 威廉姆斯称美联储无需很快调整利率
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，他认为没有必要 "很快 "调整利率，并补充说美联储必须确保关税不会导致持续的高通胀。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said he doesn’t see a need to adjust interest rates “any time soon,” adding the Fed must ensure tariffs don’t lead to persistently high inflation.】

item.title: 波多黎各大停电再次引发取消电网合同的压力
item.description: 周四，全岛停电进入第二天，波多黎各的工作人员急忙恢复照明。【原文：Crews in Puerto Rico were rushing to get the lights back on Thursday as an island-wide blackout entered its second day.】

item.title: 美国初请失业金人数降至二月初以来最低
item.description: 美国失业救济金申请降至两个月来的最低水平，与稳定的劳动力市场相一致。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits fell to the lowest level in two months, consistent with a stable labor market.】

item.title: 美国单户住宅开工量创一年来最大降幅
item.description: 由于高房价和抵押贷款利率导致需求疲软，建筑商对破土动工信心不足，美国 3 月份的房屋开工率创下一年来最大降幅。【原文：Housing starts in the US fell in March by the most in a year, as weak demand from high prices and mortgage rates gives builders little confidence to break ground.】

item.title: 奥地利支持利用被冻结的俄罗斯资产帮助乌克兰
item.description: 奥地利新任财政部长马库斯-马尔特鲍尔（Markus Marterbauer）表示支持利用冻结的俄罗斯中央银行资产进一步帮助乌克兰进行自卫。【原文：Austria’s new finance minister, Markus Marterbauer, signaled support for using frozen Russian central bank assets to provide further help for Ukraine to defend itself.】

item.title: 加纳股价傲视全球 释放债务危机后的信心信号
item.description: 由于加纳政府在痛苦的债务重组后承诺削减开支，推动通胀和借贷成本下降，加纳股票基准领涨全球股市。【原文：Ghana’s stocks benchmark is leading global equity gains as the government’s commitment to cut spending after a painful debt restructuring pushes inflation and borrowing costs lower.】

item.title: 特朗普关税担忧威胁经济复苏，欧洲央行再次降息
item.description: 由于全球贸易紧张局势有可能破坏该地区的经济复苏，欧洲中央银行自去年 6 月以来第七次降低利率。【原文：The European Central Bank lowered interest rates for the seventh time since last June as global trade tensions threaten to derail the region’s economic recovery.】

item.title: 雕刻家融资近 10 亿美元寻求私人债务交易
item.description: Sculptor Capital Management Inc. 为其机会型基金募集了约 9 亿美元，该公司希望利用市场混乱的机会。【原文：Sculptor Capital Management Inc. raised about $900 million for its opportunistic fund as the firm looks to capitalize on market dislocations.】

item.title: 英国石油公司董事长伦德不顾抗议投票再次当选董事会成员
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）即将离任的董事长海尔格-隆德（Helge Lund）在大量抗议投票中再次当选为公司董事会成员。【原文：BP Plc’s outgoing Chairman Helge Lund was re-elected to the company’s board amid a sizable protest vote.】

item.title: 客户应对波动，施瓦布交易额超预期
item.description: 由于散户投资者在今年前三个月急于应对市场波动，嘉信理财公司（Charles Schwab Corp.【原文：Charles Schwab Corp.’s daily average trades exceeded expectations as retail investors rushed to respond to market volatility in the first three months of the year.】

item.title: 贸易战将加拿大能源安全置于选票之上
item.description:
自由党首相马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）和他的保守党对手 都承诺要为特朗普提供保障。【原文：

Both Liberal Prime Minister Mark Carney and his Conservative opponent are promising to Trump-proof supplies.

】

item.title: 收购瑞波公司后，Hidden Road 获得经纪商牌照
item.description: Hidden Road 获得了经纪商经营许可证，这是公司扩大主要经纪业务以接触更多机构投资者的一部分。【原文：Hidden Road received a license to operate as a broker-dealer, part of the firm’s expansion of its prime-brokerage business to reach more institutional investors.】

item.title: 世界上最大的痛苦贸易变得更加痛苦
item.description:
美国的缓慢流失

【原文：

The slow drain from the US

】

item.title: 关税前购物狂潮拯救美国国内生产总值
item.description: 我是美国经济编辑塞西尔-道拉特（Cécile Daurat）。今天我们关注美国零售销售。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。注：《经济日报》将于复活节假期后的周一重磅推出。【原文：I’m Cécile Daurat, an economics editor in the US. Today we’re looking at US retail sales. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here. Note: Economics Daily will return Monday following the Easter holiday.】

item.title: Infosys 预测销售增长放缓，原因是 IT 支出低迷
item.description: Infosys Ltd. 预测，由于企业削减大型信息技术项目以应对地缘政治和经济挑战，今年的销售增长将放缓。【原文：Infosys Ltd. predicted slowing sales growth for this year, as corporations curtail large information technology projects to prepare for geopolitical and economic challenges.】

item.title: 土耳其意外加息以赢得市场信心
item.description: 在国内动荡和美国关税计划导致里拉抛售之后，土耳其央行试图安抚投资者，周四出人意料地提高了主要利率。【原文：Turkey raised its main interest rate on Thursday, in a surprise move as the central bank seeks to reassure investors after domestic turmoil and US tariff plans led the lira to sell off.】

item.title: 这位首席执行官想让你知道，他在做账时并没有偷钱
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，奥利维亚-浦（Olivia Poh）将讲述一家软银支持的初创公司误入歧途的故事。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Olivia Poh tells the story of a SoftBank-backed startup that went astray.】

item.title: 乌克兰维持关键利率不变，通胀有望很快缓解
item.description: 乌克兰央行停止了一系列加息行动，因为决策者预计通胀将开始缓解，尽管他们承诺保持政策的灵活性。【原文：Ukraine’s central bank halted a series of interest-rate increases as policymakers expect inflation to start easing, though they pledged to maintain policy flexibility.】

item.title: 越南到美国的运费即将起飞
item.description: 对于东南亚尤其是越南的出口商来说，航运旺季提前几个月到来，需求激增，预计将推高运费。【原文：For exporters in Southeast Asia and especially those in Vietnam, peak shipping season is arriving a few months early amid a surge in demand that’s expected to push freight rates higher.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税政策正在伤害他想要帮助的企业
item.description:
企业正在搁置招聘和投资计划，同时考虑如何应对关税。【原文：

Companies are putting hiring and investment plans on hold while they figure out how to cope with the tariffs.

】

item.title: 交易退出缓慢，Blackstone 敦促迅速结束关税动荡
item.description: Blackstone Inc.总裁乔恩-格雷（Jon Gray）表示，各国政府若能迅速采取行动，解决美国新关税带来的不确定性，将减少影响并增强投资者信心。【原文：Blackstone Inc. President Jon Gray said governments that act swiftly to resolve the uncertainty from new US tariffs will reduce the fallout and bolster investor confidence.】

item.title: 关注欧洲央行准备降息的现场报道
item.description: 法兰克福欧洲中央银行总部。摄影师：亚历克斯-克劳斯/布鲁姆伯格【原文：The headquarters of the European Central Bank in Frankfurt. Photographer: Alex Kraus/Bloomberg】

item.title: 特朗普抨击摆脱 "资金大挤压 "的非洲国家
item.description: 非洲各国政府几乎没有喘息的机会。【原文：African governments can barely catch a break.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）将继续与孟加拉国讨论员工级别协议
item.description: 国际货币基金组织表示，近期将继续与孟加拉国讨论达成员工层面的协议，这表明孟加拉国当局需要做更多工作以获得更多贷款。【原文：The International Monetary Fund said it will continue discussions with Bangladesh for a staff level agreement in the near-term, indicating that authorities will need to do more to secure further loans.】

item.title: 特朗普称美联储主席鲍威尔的解职来得不够快
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普说，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔被解职的消息来得不够快，他认为美联储应该已经降低利率，而且无论如何现在就应该这样做。【原文：President Donald Trump said Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s termination from that position can’t come quickly enough, arguing that the Fed should have lowered rates already and in any case should do so now.】

item.title: 凯雷首席执行官称通胀持续反映强劲经济
item.description: 凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.首席执行官哈维-施瓦茨（Harvey Schwartz）表示，该公司所投资公司的通胀情况表明，经济仍有韧性，因此现在判断美国是否会走向衰退还为时过早。【原文：Carlyle Group Inc. Chief Executive Officer Harvey Schwartz said inflation across the firm’s portfolio companies is showing that the economy remains resilient, making it too early to judge whether the US is headed toward a recession.】

item.title: Neuralink 的竞争对手获得 FDA 批准，迈向微创脑植入之路
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的神经链接公司（Neuralink Corp.）联合创始人之一正在制造一种与众不同的大脑植入物。【原文：One of the co-founders of Elon Musk’s Neuralink Corp. is building a different kind of brain implant.】
